thoughts.text: The web search results suggest that I can install Node.js without sudo by downloading it from the official website and configuring npm to use a directory in my home directory for global packages. I'll follow the instructions provided in the search results.
thoughts.reasoning: Installing Node.js without sudo is necessary because I don't have superuser privileges. The method suggested in the search results seems to be the most suitable for my situation.
thoughts.plan:
- Download Node.js
- Configure npm
- Install NextJS
- Develop the frontend of the app
- Install other necessary libraries
- Start developing the rest of the app
thoughts.criticism: I should have checked if Node.js was already installed before attempting to install NextJS. This would have saved time and avoided the error.
thoughts.speak: I'm going to download Node.js and configure npm.

args.command_line: wget https://nodejs.org/dist/v14.17.3/node-v14.17.3-linux-x64.tar.xz && tar -xf node-v14.17.3-linux-x64.tar.xz && export PATH=$PATH:~/node-v14.17.3-linux-x64/bin && npm config set prefix ~/.npm-packages
